Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum led the Celtics to a 132-119 pounding of the New York Knicks, with a dominant performance of 37 points, 4 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Pre-Game Insights: The New York Knicks added OG Anunoby last season and Mikal Bridges in the offseason to shore up the team's wing defense, but Jayson Tatum still managed to carve up the Knicks.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla kept Jayson Tatum on the bench for the majority of the second half as the Celtics cruised to a victory, with Tatum scoring 12 points in the third quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jayson Tatum shot 8-for-11 from deep, punishing the Knicks when they gave him too much space, and the Celtics took a 75-55 lead by halftime.
Others: The game was part of the season opener for both teams, with the Celtics raising their championship banner before the game.
